Title: EU clamps down on food waste, fast fashion
Summary: EU lawmakers to give final green light Tuesday to a law on slashing back the mountains of food wasted in Europe each year . Brussels estimates the 27-nation bloc generates the EU's annual food waste of more than $1 billion a year .

Title: AFAN, African Holdings seal deal to pioneer blockchain, tokenisation in Agriculture
Summary: The All Farmers Association of Nigeria (AFAN) announced the signing of a landmark Memorandum of Agreement (MoA) with African Holdings Corporation (AHC) to usher in a new era of agriculture . AFAN, African Holdings seal deal to pioneer blockchain, tokenisation in Agriculture .

Title: Damilare Fakorede of aiNova Africa Showcases Africa’s AI Leadership at London Tech Week 2025
Summary: aiNova Africa was selected by the UK’s Department for Business and Trade (DBT) as a delegate company to participate in London Tech Week 2025 (LTW25) The company is Africa's leading AI advisory and digital transformation company . It is one of the world's most prestigious gatherings for technology leaders, innovators

Title: Kwara deploys 1,500 health workers for integrated health outreach
Summary: Kwara State government deployed 1,500 health workers to effect its integrated health outreach programme (Kwara I-HOP) Disclosing this at the flag-off in Ilorin was the state’s Executive Secretary, Primary Health Care Development Agency, Prof Nusirat Elelu .

Title: Ambassadorial list: Tinubu may prioritise appointments to G-20 nations, Bwala states
Summary: President Bola Tinubu may prioritise ambassadorial appointments to G-20 nations . Spokesperson to the Presidency, Dr Daniel Bwala, has said .

Title: Energy Transition: NEITI tasks CSOs on tracking govts, companies’ commitments
Summary: Executive Secretary of NEITI, Dr. Orji Ogbonnaya Orji, made the call in Abuja . He urged CSOs to take a leading role in holding governments and companies accountable for their energy transition commitments .

Title: Customs, defence bureau test locally built airboat for anti-smuggling operations
Summary: Nigeria Customs Service, NCS and Defence Research and Development Bureau, DRDB, have jointly tested a homebuilt airboat at Jabi Lake, Abuja . The locally developed vessel was designed to maneuver in shallow and hard-to-reach waterways .

Title: Foreign portfolio inflow up 354% to N609.73bn in 3yrs
Summary: Foreign Portfolio inflow on the Nigerian stock market has increased by 354.4% to N609.73 billion . As outflow increases by 382.2% . The domestic and foreign transactions report was released by the Nigerian Exchange Limited, NGX .

Title: FCT Police commence investigation over life-less body discovered at NASS car park
Summary: FCT Police Command in Abuja has begun an investigation to unravel the mystery . The discovery of a man’s dead body inside a car at NASS car park, on Sunday, was made public .

Title: Tinubu orders overhaul of military operations after Borno massacre
Summary: Tinubu orders overhaul of military operations after Borno massacre . Armed Forces to review ongoing security operations, including deployment of advanced military hardware and surveillance equipment .

Title: PENGASSAN orders strike at Cameron-Onesubsea over anti-labour practices
Summary: The Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria has ordered its members at Cameron/Onesubsea Offshore Systems Nigeria Limited to commence an indefinite strike beginning 12:00 am on Tuesday . The union accused the company of frustrating all efforts to resolve outstanding grievances relating to the 2025 Collective Bargaining Agreement .

Title: Eagles can win in Bloemfontein – Nwabali
Summary: Stanley Nwabali feels the Super Eagles have the quality to nick a win against South Africa in Bloemfon . The Super Eagles are top of the group with 16 points, followed by the Benyans, Canada and Mexico . They need a win to revive their chances of winning against the Bafans .

Title: Siasia tells Chelle to rely on Lookman, Arokodare
Summary: Nigeria travel to Bloemfontein following a narrow 1-0 victory over Rwanda in Uyo . The win kept the Super Eagles within touching distance of Group C leaders South Africa, with victory at the Free State Stadium potentially reducing the gap to three points . The 1994 AFCON winner urged the team to limit defensive errors, avoid

Title: US arrests convicted Nigerian in illegal migrants crackdown
Summary: The United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement Agency has arrested a previously convicted Nigerian, Rotimi Oladimeji, in an operation targeting illegal immigrants across the country . He was convicted of aiding other scammers in Nigeria to defraud a woman “who thought she was in an online romance with a veterinarian and animal behaviourist living in St

Title: Police probe body found in car at N’Assembly complex
Summary: The Federal Capital Territory Police Command says it has begun investigations following the discovery of a lifeless body inside a vehicle at the National Assembly Complex in Abuja . Some reports (not by PUNCH Metro) had stated that the body was that of a 55-year-old man, identified as Gaddafi Iwar, who was a construction worker .
